recipes.ingredients: Breastmilk (on demand). Mother: balanced diet, hydration.
recipes.instructions: Encourage exclusive, on-demand breastfeeding. Offer skin-to-skin, frequent feeds; seek lactation support if difficulties.

recipes.ingredients: Commercial infant formula, safe potable water
recipes.instructions: Follow manufacturer dilution instructions. Use sterile bottles, prepare fresh feeds, discard leftovers. Seek pediatrician before formula use.
Encourage frequent breastfeeding (8-12 times per day) to provide adequate protein for growth and development.
Prepare formula following guidelines to ensure protein intake matches age needs. Consult pediatrician.

recipes.recipe_name: Breastmilk Iron Provision in Early Months
recipes.instructions: Exclusive breastfeeding supports iron stores from birth; continue without supplements unless advised.
Use iron-fortified formula if breastfeeding not possible; prepare as directed.
Frequent breastfeeding ensures calcium for bone development; maintain maternal calcium-rich diet.
Follow preparation instructions for calcium delivery; use fortified formula as recommended.
Exclusive breastfeeding provides essential vitamin A for vision and immunity; feed on demand.
Prepare fortified formula to meet vitamin A requirements; discard unused portions.
Breastmilk supplies vitamin C for immune support; ensure maternal intake of fruits and vegetables.
Use fortified formula for vitamin C; prepare fresh and consult healthcare provider.

recipes.ingredients: Ragi flour, water, mashed banana, breastmilk/formula (optional), pinch jaggery (optional)
recipes.instructions: Roast 1 tbsp ragi flour lightly. Mix with water, simmer to thicken. Cool slightly and mash in mashed banana and a little breastmilk/formula. Serve lukewarm.

recipes.ingredients: Rice, yellow moong dal, carrot/potato (small), 1 tsp ghee
recipes.instructions: Cook equal parts rice and moong dal with chopped veg until very soft. Mash to desired consistency. Add 1 tsp ghee before serving.

recipes.ingredients: Moong dal, rice, carrot, spinach, a little ghee
recipes.instructions: Wash moong dal and rice 1:1. Add chopped veg and pressure cook till very soft. Mash gently and add ghee. Cool to suitable temp.

recipes.ingredients: Fresh paneer, breastmilk/formula/milk (as per age), banana optional
recipes.instructions: Crumble soft paneer and mash with a little milk or breastmilk to suitable consistency. Serve small portions.

recipes.ingredients: Idli batter (rice+urad dal) or instant rava idli mix, grated carrot/peas optional
recipes.instructions: Steam small idlis. For babies, mash with a little dal water or ghee as needed.

recipes.ingredients: Semolina (suji), water/milk, small amount ghee, jaggery optional
recipes.instructions: Roast suji lightly in ghee, add water/milk and simmer until soft. For babies, avoid excess sugar; use jaggery if needed in small amount.
Mash cooked rice and mix in warm ghee. Serve lukewarm in small portions.
Mash a small portion of ripe avocado to a smooth texture; serve small spoonfuls.

recipes.ingredients: Ragi flour, water/milk, small chopped dates (small amount)
recipes.instructions: Cook ragi flour in water; add mashed dates for taste and iron boost (small amounts). Cool and serve.

recipes.ingredients: Moong dal, rice, chopped spinach, carrot, ghee
recipes.instructions: Cook rice and dal with chopped spinach until very soft. Mash and add ghee. Serve warm.

recipes.ingredients: Ragi flour, milk/formula (or mix with breastmilk later), banana optional
recipes.instructions: Cook ragi in milk; cool to lukewarm and serve. Use breastmilk/formula for younger infants if needed.
Mix a little curd into soft rice. Serve cool or room temp. Use small portions for 6–11m as appropriate.

recipes.recipe_name: Carrot & Potato Puree (vitamin A from carrot)
recipes.instructions: Steam or boil carrot & potato till very soft. Mash thoroughly, add a little ghee.
Bake or steam sweet potato. Mash and add a little ghee. Serve warm.
Peel, steam apple until tender, mash to smooth puree. Cool and serve.

recipes.ingredients: Ripe banana, tiny amount of orange zest/juice (very small)
recipes.instructions: Mash banana; add a few drops of orange juice (ensure no citrus reaction) for vitamin C. Use minimal juice to avoid acidity.

recipes.ingredients: Rice, moong dal, mixed vegetables (carrot, peas, spinach), ghee
recipes.instructions: Pressure-cook rice and dal with chopped vegetables till soft. Mash lightly and finish with 1 tsp ghee. Serve warm.

recipes.recipe_name: Rice-Dal Combo (Khichdi with ghee & dal tadka)
recipes.ingredients: Rice, mixed dal, ghee, small vegetables
recipes.instructions: Cook rice and dal together with vegetables until soft. Add ghee or butter for energy. Serve mashable portions.

recipes.ingredients: Soaked moong dal ground to batter, grated carrot/spinach
recipes.instructions: Make thin batter from soaked dal; add grated veggies. Cook on tawa lightly with little oil/ghee. Cut into small pieces.
Crumble paneer and sauté gently with peas and a little ghee. Mash to soft texture for toddlers.

recipes.ingredients: Idli pieces or batter, vegetables, little oil/ghee
recipes.instructions: Crumble idlis and sauté with chopped vegetables and a bit of ghee for an easy, carb-rich breakfast.

recipes.ingredients: Soft whole wheat roti, mashed seasonal vegetables
recipes.instructions: Serve well-cooked soft roti pieces with mashed vegetable curry for easy chewing.

recipes.ingredients: Whole wheat flour, grated paneer, little ghee for cooking
recipes.instructions: Stuff soft paneer filling into dough and cook with a little ghee. Serve warm in small pieces.

recipes.recipe_name: Peanut Powder Rice (no whole nuts if choking risk)
recipes.ingredients: Cooked rice, roasted peanut powder (very small quantity), ghee
recipes.instructions: Mix a small spoon of finely powdered roasted peanuts into warm rice with ghee. Ensure no whole nuts for toddler safety.

recipes.ingredients: Rice, moong dal, chopped spinach, ghee
recipes.instructions: Cook rice and dal with spinach added; mash lightly and finish with ghee. Offer warm.

recipes.ingredients: Ragi flour, oats, chopped dates, milk
recipes.instructions: Cook ragi + oats in milk/water. Add chopped dates for iron and sweetness. Cool to serve.

recipes.ingredients: Ragi flour, milk (or formula), mashed banana optional
recipes.instructions: Cook ragi in milk; serve lukewarm. For toddlers, full milk is appropriate unless doctor advises otherwise.

recipes.ingredients: Soft rice, plain curd, grated carrot
recipes.instructions: Mix curd into warm-cool rice with grated carrot for vitamins and calcium. Serve at room temp.
Steam vegetables until soft, mash and mix with ghee. Offer warm.
Mash cooked sweet potato and add ghee. Serve in small portions.

recipes.ingredients: Steamed apple mashed, tiny orange juice or mashed ripe papaya
recipes.instructions: Steam apple; mash. Add minimal orange/papaya to boost vitamin C. Serve fresh.
Cook spinach with peeled tomato till very soft; mash and add ghee.

recipes.ingredients: Rice, mixed dal, ghee, mild vegetables
recipes.instructions: Cook rice and dal together with vegetables until soft. Add generous ghee for energy. Serve warm.

recipes.ingredients: Whole wheat roti (soft), vegetable curry, ghee
recipes.instructions: Serve soft roti with vegetable sabzi and a small spoon of ghee on top for added energy.

recipes.recipe_name: Khichdi with Mixed Dal + Paneer Crumble
recipes.ingredients: Rice, mixed dal, small cubes of paneer, vegetables, ghee
recipes.instructions: Cook rice and dal; add paneer cubes or crumble paneer into hot khichdi. Finish with ghee.
Scramble egg lightly in ghee; cook until just set and soft. Serve small pieces to child.
Cook rice with vegetables and a little ghee. Serve soft and fluffy.

recipes.ingredients: Soft roti, boiled and mashed potato with little ghee
recipes.instructions: Serve small roti pieces with warm potato mash. Ensure soft texture.

recipes.recipe_name: Milk Banana Smoothie with Peanut Powder (if no allergy)
recipes.ingredients: Milk, banana, small spoon peanut powder, 1 tsp ghee/butter optional
recipes.instructions: Blend milk and banana; mix in a small amount of peanut powder. Serve in small portions.

recipes.ingredients: Whole wheat dough, grated paneer, ghee
recipes.instructions: Cook paratha with paneer stuffing on tawa using little ghee; serve warm in small pieces.

recipes.recipe_name: Chana Dal & Spinach Curry with Rice (soft)
recipes.ingredients: Chana dal (soaked), spinach, mild spices, ghee
recipes.instructions: Cook soaked chana dal until soft, add pureed spinach and mild tempering. Serve with soft rice.

recipes.recipe_name: Ragi Oats Porridge with Dates (iron boost)
recipes.ingredients: Ragi flour, oats, chopped dates, milk
recipes.instructions: Cook ragi and oats in milk; add chopped dates. Cool and serve.

recipes.ingredients: Paneer, peas, mild spices, soft roti
recipes.instructions: Sauté crumbled paneer with peas and minimal spices, serve with soft roti.
Cook ragi in milk and blend with dates paste. Cool to warm and serve.
Cook vegetables until soft; mash lightly and add ghee. Serve warm.

recipes.recipe_name: Sweet Potato & Carrot Mash with Ghee
recipes.instructions: Steam sweet potato & carrot; mash and mix with ghee.

recipes.recipe_name: Fruit Smoothie (milk + banana + berries or papaya)
recipes.ingredients: Milk, banana, papaya or berries, little honey if >1yr
recipes.instructions: Blend milk with fruit. Serve small amount.
Cook peeled tomato with spinach until soft; mash lightly and serve.

recipes.ingredients: Rice, mixed vegetables, paneer cubes, ghee
recipes.instructions: Cook rice with vegetables and paneer cubes with adequate ghee for energy density. Serve warm.
Cook together till soft, finish with ghee to raise energy content.

recipes.ingredients: Soaked chickpeas, mild spices, tomatoes, ghee
recipes.instructions: Soak chickpeas overnight, cook until soft. Mash lightly for kids and serve with rice.

recipes.ingredients: Paneer, peas, mild tomato gravy, roti
recipes.instructions: Cook paneer & peas in mild gravy; serve with soft roti.

recipes.ingredients: Rice, mixed veggies, soy sauce optional, oil/ghee
recipes.instructions: Stir fry cooked rice lightly with vegetables and a little oil. Keep seasoning mild for kids.

recipes.ingredients: Whole wheat roti, potato, peas, mild spices
recipes.instructions: Serve soft cooked roti with mashed potato-peas sabzi.
Cook paneer in mild tomato-cashew gravy with butter; keep spices low for kids.

recipes.recipe_name: Peanut Butter Banana Sandwich (if no allergy)
recipes.ingredients: Whole wheat bread, peanut butter (smooth), banana slices
recipes.instructions: Spread thin peanut butter, add banana slices and serve small sandwich halves. Ensure no whole nuts.
Cook chana dal until soft. Add spinach puree and simmer. Serve with rice/roti.
Cook ragi in milk, add chopped dates. Cool to suitable temp and serve.
Cook paneer & peas in mild gravy; serve with roti or rice.

recipes.recipe_name: Milkshake with Almonds (age-appropriate, nut paste if safe)
recipes.ingredients: Milk, banana, soaked almond paste (optional), honey if >1yr
recipes.instructions: Blend milk with banana and very small amount of almond paste. Serve small portions.

recipes.ingredients: Carrot, pumpkin, coconut milk (optional), mild spices
recipes.instructions: Cook vegetables until soft. Mash lightly or serve bite-sized pieces. Add little coconut milk for taste.
Bake or roast cubes until soft. Serve slightly mashed or as small bites.

recipes.ingredients: Seasonal fruits (banana, papaya, orange segments), plain yogurt
recipes.instructions: Cut soft fruits into small pieces. Mix with plain yogurt; serve chilled (not cold).
Cook peeled tomatoes with chopped capsicum until soft; mash lightly for small children.

recipes.ingredients: Rice, mixed dal, vegetable curry, ghee
recipes.instructions: Serve rice and dal with vegetable curry and a spoon of ghee for higher energy density.
Serve soft roti with paneer sabzi and curd for energy and calcium.

recipes.recipe_name: Egg Curry (soft) with Rice (if non-veg allowed)
recipes.instructions: Cook eggs in mild tomato gravy. Serve cut into small pieces with rice.
Soak chickpeas overnight, cook until soft, add spinach and simmer. Serve with rice.

recipes.recipe_name: Vegetable Pulao with Nuts (soft pieces for kids)
recipes.ingredients: Rice, vegetables, crushed nuts (small amount, optional), ghee
recipes.instructions: Cook rice with vegetables. Add crushed nuts paste (or omit if allergy). Serve warm.

recipes.ingredients: Whole wheat roti, baked sweet potato mashed
recipes.instructions: Serve soft roti with mashed sweet potato mixed with a little ghee.

recipes.ingredients: Whole wheat bread, smooth peanut butter, banana optional
recipes.instructions: Spread peanut butter thinly and add banana slices. Cut into small pieces for child.
Cook paneer in mild gravy with butter; serve in small portions.
Add spinach puree to cooked dal and simmer. Serve with rice.
Soak chickpeas overnight; pressure cook until very soft. Serve with rice or soft roti.
Prepare paneer curry with minimal spices and serve with rice/roti.

recipes.recipe_name: Milkshake with Soaked Almond Paste (small amount)
recipes.ingredients: Milk, banana, small amount almond paste
recipes.instructions: Blend milk and banana with a small amount of almond paste. Serve small portions.
Cook vegetables till soft and serve mashed for kids.
Roast until soft; mash or cut into small pieces.

recipes.ingredients: Orange segments, papaya, kiwi (age-appropriate), plain yogurt
recipes.instructions: Cut fruit into small, soft pieces; mix with yogurt. Avoid kiwi for very young if allergy concern.
Cook peeled tomato with capsicum until soft; mash lightly for kids.

recipes.recipe_name: Mixed Vegetable & Paneer Curry with Rice
recipes.instructions: Cook rice; prepare paneer & veg curry. Add ghee for energy. Serve warm.
Soak chickpeas overnight; cook until soft. Prepare mild gravy and serve with roti.
Cook paneer with peas in mild gravy; serve with soft roti.

recipes.recipe_name: Egg Curry with Rice (if non-veg allowed)
recipes.instructions: Prepare eggs in mild curry and serve with rice. Cut into small pieces for child.
Cook rice with vegetables and serve warm.
Serve soft roti with potato-peas sabzi; ensure soft textures for kids.

recipes.recipe_name: Peanut Butter Banana Sandwich (no whole nuts)
recipes.ingredients: Whole wheat bread, smooth peanut butter, banana
recipes.instructions: Spread peanut butter thinly, add banana slices, cut to small pieces. Watch for allergies.
Cook paneer in mild gravy with butter and serve warm.
Soak chickpeas overnight; pressure cook until soft. Serve with rice.
Cook dal and add spinach puree; simmer and serve with rice.
Cook paneer in mild gravy and serve with rice.
Cook ragi or oats in milk; add jaggery lightly for taste; serve lukewarm.

recipes.recipe_name: Mixed Vegetable Curry with Carrot & Pumpkin
recipes.ingredients: Carrot, pumpkin, other vegetables, little oil/ghee
recipes.instructions: Cook vegetables until soft, serve in small bite-sized pieces.

recipes.ingredients: Sweet potato, little oil, mild seasoning
recipes.instructions: Bake soft sweet potato sticks until tender; serve slightly mashed for younger kids.
Blend fruits with yogurt for a vitamin-rich smoothie. Serve chilled but not too cold.
Cook peeled tomatoes with capsicum until soft; serve mashed or bite-sized.
